speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's our show for today.  But before we close I'd like to invite you all to join us here at KACL in wishing a fond farewell to our Happy Chef, Leo Pasquale, as he bubble-wraps his crepe pan and heads south towards sunny Santa Fe.  Leo, you stirred us with your passion; melted us with your charm; added spice to our lives.  Now as you whisk yourself away let's not say goodbye, but rather "tartar" for now.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane, KACL 780.

speaker: Roz
text: [_coming into the booth_] Well, at least you stopped short of saying, "I'll be fricasseeing you."  You ready to go to Leo's party?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God, there is nothing I detest more than a KACL goodbye party.  They're all the same -- twist-top wine with a bunch of people standing round awkwardly trying to summon up some affection for someone they hardly even know.  It always ends up reeking of insincerity.

speaker: Bulldog
text: What are we gonna do, Doc?  He's leaving us.

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog and Leo were tight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Bulldog certainly is.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I love that guy, man.  He'd give me all his leftovers.

speaker: Roz
text: I warned Leo: you keep feeding him, he'll keep coming back.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You going to his party?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I think I'm going to pass.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh come on Doc, you gotta at least have a drink, give him a hug.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is precisely what I'm trying to avoid.  Since when did we become a society of huggers?  We hug for everything nowadays.  "Hello" - hug; "Congratulations" - hug; "Nice haircut" - hug.  It's absurd.  I mean, if we want to express real emotion for someone - I mean, where is there left to go?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I've had good luck with the storage closet.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I think you're way too uptight about this.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, no.  I see the Doc's point.  We all have different ways of saying goodbye.  Me?  I prefer this method: Get out! [_blows his horn_] Come on! [_blows horn_] I got a show to do! _Frasier and Roz are forced out into the corridor amongst the obvious party._

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I think hugging is very healthy.  I read somewhere that if you have physical contact on a regular basis, it can actually extend your life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, in that case you should outlive Styrofoam!

speaker: Leo
text: Frasier, you made it!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know I wouldn't miss saying goodbye to you for the world.

speaker: Roz
text: [_hugging Leo emphatically_] Oh Leo, we're going to miss you so much!

speaker: Tom
text: [_going to shake Leo's hand_] We sure are.  Oh, what the heck. [_he hugs Leo instead; Leo turns to Frasier expectantly_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_obviously uncomfortable_] You have no idea how hard this is for me. [_Frasier hugs Leo also_] **TIES THAT BLIND** _Scene 2 -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Niles are sitting at their usual table having just ordered. _

speaker: Frasier
text: I must say, Niles, that is a striking tie you're wearing.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  It was a gift from Maris.  She had it made for me to commemorate the end of that dreadful winter she had her obesity scare.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes.  I remember her struggle to lose that holiday pound.

speaker: Niles
text: After she'd restored her figure she had Yoshi set fire to a hippopotamus topiary she felt had taunted her.  Then, as a visual reminder never to let herself go again, she had this tie made for me out of the legs of her fat pants. [_the waiter brings his coffee_] Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I would think wearing a tie that Maris gave you might make you feel a little bit melancholy.

speaker: Niles
text: On the contrary.  I have every reason to believe Maris and I may be on the road to reconciliation.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: We met for lunch today.  I told her I couldn't stand to be in separation limbo anymore, and unless she wanted the marriage to end we simply had to get into counseling.

speaker: Frasier
text: And she agreed?

speaker: Niles
text: Her exact words were, "I'll think about it."  But I saw a twinkle in her eye I have not seen since the neighbor children discovered our new electric fence.

speaker: Frasier
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you. [_they clink cups; then, examining his coffee_] The foam is a tad listless today.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_examining his coffee also_] Yes.  I can tell without looking that they've got Chad back on steamer duty.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking over_] You _are_ good.

speaker: Messenger
text: Excuse me.  Dr. Niles Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: I am.

speaker: Messenger
text: Here. [_hands him a letter_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_opening the letter_] Who's sending me this? [_reads the letter_] "Notice: Petition... For Divorce."

speaker: Messenger
text: Sorry, man.  Cool tie. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know what to say.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... it's all right.  Would have been nice if we'd given therapy a try, but, uh... so be it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know this is little consolation, but you're to be applauded for the way you're handling this.  A lesser man would panic.

speaker: Niles
text: [_grabbing for his mobile phone_] Oh, oh, wait, wait, wait! I'll get her back.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grabbing the phone out of Niles's hands_] You have too much dignity to let yourself beg!

speaker: Niles
text: Please give me my phone back.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: Please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: Please!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it. _By now Niles is leaning across the table in a desperate bid to wrestle the phone off Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now listen.  I know you're upset, but let's remember why you left Maris in the first place: you were tired of groveling.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but I'm rested now.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_handing the phone back_] Fine!  Go ahead and toddle on back to Maris.  Let her grind you under her boot heel for another twelve years, rob you of whatever self-respect you've still retained, then we can have this conversation all over again!

speaker: Niles
text: I was unhappy, wasn't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: You were _miserable._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry.  It's just a lot to take in.  Twelve years of my life - gone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't think of it as a loss, but rather an opportunity for growth.  It's not an ending, it's...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier - no offense, but I'm familiar with all the platitudes.  I've just been served divorce papers. I need a little time to let it sink in.  If you don't mind, maybe we could not talk about it for a while.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_coming up to the table_] Hi, can I get you guys anything?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank you.  We've already been served.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry. _FADE TO:  Scene 3 -- Frasier's Apartment. Daphne comes out of Martin's bedroom with a box full of stuff and makes for the front door.  As she reaches the door she hears the key on the other side and rushes back, dropping the box on the sofa. Martin comes in. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh, you're back.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I never should have left.  The park was a disaster. You remember that outfit Mrs. Foster knitted Eddie for Christmas?  Well, I bumped into her in the lobby and she said that she was going to be going to the park and I thought, well it would be rude if I didn't at least have him wear it one time, you know?  Eddie, get in here. _Eddie walks slowly, head bowed, into the apartment wearing possibly the most ridiculous looking ensemble ever -- a multicoloured bunnet and a similar checked jacket to match. _

speaker: Martin
text: Look at the poor guy, he's humiliated.  And then of course she didn't even show up there but you know who was there? Duke and two guys from the old precinct.  "Oh Marty -- glad to see you've got something to do now you're retired"; "Hey Marty -- if I buy you some wool will you knit something for me?"

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it could have been worse.  You could have been wearing the hat she made for you. _Martin pulls out a slightly larger, similarly-colored bunnet with a scowl on his face._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear.

speaker: Martin
text: Would you take that off him?  He just looks so pathetic.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_helping Eddie_] Oh, come here you poor little fella.

speaker: Martin
text: [_noticing the box on the sofa_] What's in the box?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, nothing.  Just some old stuff I was taking down to the storage bin.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, great.  Why don't you take this with it? [_holding out his bunnet_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, just set that on top.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no.  It'll fall off if I do. [_opens the box_] Hey, this is my stuff!

speaker: Daphne
text: It's a box of junk.

speaker: Martin
text: It's not junk.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, rubbish.  It's a bunch of useless gadgets you haven't used in years.  Like this remote control to God knows what -- useless.  Just like this, [_pulls out some unidentifiable object_] whatever it is.

speaker: Martin
text: That's the SteamMaster 2000!  Like on TV, "Live life wrinkle free!"  It even comes with an attachment that cooks Chinese vegetables. _Daphne just rolls her eyes.  Frasier comes through from the bedroom as the doorbell rings._

speaker: Frasier
text: That would be Niles.  I'm taking him to lunch to get his mind off his troubles.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is that something we shouldn't talk about?

speaker: Martin
text: No, there's no reason why we shouldn't talk about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm sorry, I don't think he's ready to talk about it so we're not talking about it.

speaker: Niles
text: [_from behind the door_] Would you mind not talking about it a little less loudly?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opening the door_] Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Afternoon, all.  I appreciate your concern but I'm really doing quite well with all this.  Everything is going to be fine.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, well that's good.  I just hope you've got a good divorce lawyer, because you've been married a long time, and you gotta make sure you get your fair share.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, according to the terms of our prenuptial agreement, I believe I'm wearing my fair share.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, take a tip from your old man.  You get over there and take possession of your personal belongings before they [_at Daphne_] box them up and toss them out!

speaker: Daphne
text: When will you just admit that this junk belongs in a dustbin?

speaker: Martin
text: You know, I was on a case once where the wife constantly nagged the husband like this.  "You never put anything in the garbage.  Why don't you ever put anything in the garbage?"

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, he should have listened to her.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he did.  And that's where we found her! _Daphne and Martin head in separate directions leaving Frasier and Niles alone.  Frasier goes over to examine the box on the sofa._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I think Daphne's fighting an uphill battle with this little project of hers. [_pulls a journal out of the box_]

speaker: Niles
text: What's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a journal.

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't that mother's handwriting?

speaker: Frasier
text: These must be notes from one of her research projects. [_Frasier begins reading the book_] "It's hard to imagine two male siblings who could be more different than Frasier and Niles."

speaker: Niles
text: Good heavens.  It's about us.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_continuing_] "Though both are highly intelligent, Frasier is clearly the more dominant of the two while Niles remains extremely passive." [_turning to Niles_] Fascinating!

speaker: Niles
text: [_reading from the journal_] "Frasier never seems to get enough at mealtime.  He's nearly twice the size of Niles and often, when he thinks I'm not looking, steals his brother's food."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_continuing_] "What Niles lacks in assertiveness he makes up for in an abnormally fussy grooming regimen."

speaker: Niles
text: [_continuing_] "Frasier is exhibiting clearly anti-social tendencies.  In fact, he is extremely uncomfortable with touch, seeming to recoil from all human contact."

speaker: Frasier
text: Where does it say that?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I added "extremely," but it's right there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord.  This cuts rather close to the bone.  Just yesterday Roz was accusing me of the same thing.  I always thought it was just an aversion to social hugging but apparently it goes deeper than that.  You know, maybe this is something I should work on.  What do you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_reading from the journal_] "April 3rd.  Niles remains as docile as ever.  He constantly allows himself to be cowed and dominated, especially by females." [_drops it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you shouldn't let that upset you.  You've broken that pattern.  You could have knocked that under and gone groveling back to Maris but you didn't.  You know Niles, I don't think I've ever been more proud of you. _Frasier tries to hug Niles but just looks awkward as he hugs him at practically arm's length._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Frasier, this is awful.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, pardon me for trying.  I am new at it.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no.  You don't understand.  I did go groveling back.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: I sent the divorce papers back unsigned, along with a letter begging her to take me back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you didn't.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course I did.  You read the journal.  It's who I am.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how did she respond?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she hasn't yet.  I just messengered it to her this morning.  It's her spa day.  She won't be home until... [_checks his watch_] I still have time to get that letter back.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going with you.

speaker: Niles
text: You're a good brother.  This may be my last chance to prove once and for all that I'm not the sort of man who... who... whatever mother said.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Constantly allows himself to be cowed and dominated, especially by females."

speaker: Niles
text: I might have known you'd memorize it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  That was harsh.  Come here [_Frasier holds out his arms for a hug_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, get away from me. _End of Act 1  Act 2_ **THANK GOD TUESDAY ISN'T SOUP DAY** _Scene 1 -- Maris's house Frasier and Niles are outside Maris's back door. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm still a little uneasy about this.  What if one of the servants sees us?

speaker: Niles
text: Impossible.  They always use Maris's spa day to play hooky. I just hope she hasn't changed the locks.

speaker: Niles
text: What do you know? [_they both creep in_] You know, this is sort of exciting.  Even as a child I always fancied I might make a first-rate society cat burglar.  I think I'm right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  All it takes is stealth, cunning and a key to the door!

speaker: Niles
text: [_heading for a nearby desk_] The letter should be over here with the rest of Maris's unopened mail. [_picks it up_] Yes -- here it is.  Let's go. _Just as they go towards the exit there is loud barking and two German Shepherds come bounding up to the door._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, look, it's my puppies!  Oh, I've missed you.  Hello, Gestalt!  Hello, Gerhardt!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, don't they look just a bit agitated to you?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's because they're excited to see that the Lord has returned to the manor. [_goes to open the door_] Hello, boys! _There is a lot of snarling and biting and Niles quickly closes the door in shock._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God.  She hasn't changed the locks.  She changed the dogs!  Quick, maybe we can make it to the front door.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right! _Frasier and Niles both run away from the back door and head off stage, only to be greeted by the same barking as the dogs greet them at the other side.  They come down to the back door again where the dogs are waiting for them._

speaker: Frasier
text: They're toying with us!

speaker: Niles
text: What are we going to do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I guess we're just going to have to wait until Lady Baskerville comes back from the spa!

speaker: Niles
text: And explain our presence how?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  I do see your point.

speaker: Niles
text: We have to find some way to distract those beasts and make our escape. [_thinks for a second_] Wait.  Tuesday is Swedish meatball night for the staff.  Cook always keeps them in the refrigerator.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles.  We can't feed them raw meat, it'll only stimulate their bloodlust.

speaker: Niles
text: Just listen: one of our old dogs used to be spooked by thunderstorms.  The vet told us half of one of Maris's green pills would allow him to sleep safely right through the storm.  You get the meat, I'll get the pills.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right!

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait!  What if Maris is out of pills? _Niles laughs at the absurdity of the suggestion and Frasier sees the joke also._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] Oh, I see.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Frasier, I needed that. _DISSOLVE TO: The scene switches to later.  Frasier is down at the back door looking exasperated.  Beyond the waiting dogs, a meatball plunks into the koi pond._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, that's three meatballs in a row right in the koi pond! Stop trying to throw!  Just drop them, you can _drop_ straight, can't you?!

speaker: Niles
text: Was that a splat or a splash?

speaker: Frasier
text: A splat!  Do it again. [_more meatballs rain down_] Excellent! They're eating it!  All right that's enough. [_speaking to the dogs_] Good boys.  Yes, that's right, eat hearty.  Oh, you missed one right over there in the garden by the tulips. Oh, there's a few more over there in the koi pond next to the... sleeping koi. _Frasier wanders around waiting for the pills to take effect.  As he does so his eyes are drawn towards a painting on the wall (looking at the camera, so we can't see it)._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?  Niles, this painting here in the living room -- have you always had this?

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming down the stairs_] The one of Maris and me in the garden?  Yes, we had it commissioned on our third anniversary.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it must be a different painting.  This is Maris next to a really big tree.

speaker: Niles
text: No, there's no tree in that painting, it's... [_notices the painting_] Oh my God.  She's had me completely painted out! I don't think I can take much more of this.

speaker: Frasier
text: In that case, I wouldn't look too closely at the face of that skunk in the flowerbed.

speaker: Niles
text: [_ruefully_] Well, I suppose it's only fitting that I be commemorated in this household as a laughingstock.  She's always run roughshod over me.  Look around.  This entire room is a monument to my spinelessness!

speaker: Frasier
text: How so?

speaker: Niles
text: [_pointing at an ornament_] This Dresden Shepherdess?  A peace offering I made to Maris when I was foolish enough to point out an extra syllable in a Haiku she'd written. [_motions around the room_] Choose another item.  Anything.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pointing_] Oh, that candelabra?

speaker: Niles
text: Louis Quatorze!  What better way to apologise for the time I attempted to grow a moustache?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think you owe us all a candelabra for that. [_noticing outside_] Niles, look.  It seems to be working.  The dogs are getting drowsy.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, if just once Maris had given in, in all those years, I might think there was hope for our marriage.  But she never budged an inch!  Even on those rare occasions that I reported back to you that I had prevailed...?

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know why I thought I could convince her with that couples' therapy idea.  Well... [_heads over to the desk_] I'm not going to be her whipping boy anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm signing the divorce papers.  She wants to initiate proceedings.  Let's proceed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you know I'll support any decision you make, but are you sure?

speaker: Niles
text: [_pauses, then_] Absolutely. _He takes a moment to sign the papers before putting them back in the envelope, making sure to remove his groveling note._

speaker: Niles
text: That's done.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you OK?

speaker: Niles
text: I will be. [_looks outside_] Looks like the dogs are asleep. Shall we go?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know.  Maybe they're just playing possum with us.

speaker: Niles
text: Frankly, I don't care.  After what I've just done you think I'm going to let a couple of dogs frighten me?  This is the last time I'm leaving this house.  I'm going to walk through that door with my head held high.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good for you.  I'm going to run like hell out the front door.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait up! _Both make a bolt for the front door while the dogs are still sleeping.  FADE TO:  Scene 2 -- Frasier's Apartment. Martin is introducing Daphne to yet another one of his ridiculous gadgets. _

speaker: Martin
text: Now the beauty of the "Hot & Foamy" is the ultra-quick heating action.  You just plug it in and two minutes later, presto, guess what comes out?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastic_] Well, the obvious answer would be shaving cream, so I'll go with - music?

speaker: Martin
text: You had a lot of sassy things to say about my clothes steamer too.  But didn't those snow peas taste delicious? _Martin takes the Hot And Foamy into the bathroom.  Meanwhile Frasier and Niles come in._

speaker: Daphne
text: Where did you two slip off to?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I just had some papers to sign.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Niles has decided to begin divorce proceedings.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: It's OK.  I feel good about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now we thought it might be nice to have a family dinner this evening at Chez Shea, so we stopped by to invite the two of you to join us.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that would be nice.  I'll just go freshen up. [_heads to her bedroom_]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sounds great.  And Niles, I'm proud of you.  I know this isn't easy, but in the long run I know you'll be happier. I'm damn sure I will be.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't believe it.  It's really over.

speaker: Frasier
text: If you choose you never have to see Maris again.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, please.  Half the time I couldn't see her when she was standing right in front of me. _Both laugh at this joke.  However, Niles's laugh quickly begins to turn to hyperventilation._

speaker: Niles
text: [_still laughing_] I can't breathe. [_Frasier points and laughs_] No, really, [_getting serious_] I can't breathe!  Frasier, I signed divorce papers!  What was I thinking?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, you're not having second thoughts?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.  When I was caught up in the adrenaline it all seemed fine, but now in the clear light of day...

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now, Niles.  It's only natural for you to feel a little bit shaky, but believe me, you made the right decision.

speaker: Niles
text: How do I know that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_picking up the journal_] Let's just check what prompted us to it. [_begins reading the journal_] Here: "Niles is incapable of asserting himself, especially in front of females!"

speaker: Niles
text: Keep going -- this is helping.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_continuing_] "As I write this he lies, staring out the window, licking himself!" [_Frasier looks up strangely_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_confused_] What?

speaker: Frasier
text: "He's become so subservient lately that when he's finished grooming himself he often begins licking Frasier."

speaker: Niles
text: [_puzzled_] I have no memory of that!

speaker: Frasier
text: "April 14th.  The day I've dreaded for weeks: Frasier died this morning.  I never would have guessed that my heart could ache so over the death of my beloved lab rat.  My only consolation is the knowledge that I will soon give birth to my first child."

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking the journal off him in shock_] Frasier... do you know what this means?

speaker: Frasier
text: Our mother named us after rodents.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  It means I have ended my marriage to the woman I love based on the case history of a spineless rat! [_realizing_] Oh My God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God!  Maris has seen the papers.  It's too late to take it back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, your reasoning was still sound.

speaker: Niles
text: [_becoming hysterical_] My reasoning?!  My reasoning was based on my mother's obsession WITH VERMIN!!! _He throws down the journal in disgust.  His shouting brings Martin and Daphne back into the living room._

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell's going on here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles is just a bit distraught.

speaker: Niles
text: [_hysterical_] Distraught?  MY LIFE IS OVER!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, don't talk that way!  My God man, you've got to calm down.

speaker: Niles
text: [_struggling into the bathroom_] All right.  I-I'm going to splash some cold water on my face. [_closes the door_]

speaker: Martin
text: Is he going to be all right?  I've never seen him like this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course he'll be all right, Dad. [_banging on the bathroom door_] Niles!  Just remember to keep breathing.  And trust me -- this is not the end.  Your life is not over! [_no response_] Niles!  NILES! _From inside the bathroom a sound like a GUNSHOT is heard. Frasier, Daphne and Martin all look horrified._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God! _Frasier timidly opens the door.  This is where writing cannot express the true hilarity of this visual joke.  Suffice it to say it is one of the funniest scenes ever seen on Frasier.  Niles is covered head to foot in shaving foam, as is the entire bathroom.  Niles walks slowly out with a look of shock on his face (or what can be seen of his face under the foam).  Frasier just looks completely bewildered._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!  Are you all right?

speaker: Niles
text: [_calmly_] I'm fine.  Just a little hot.  And foamy.

speaker: Martin
text: You know what must have happened?  My Hot & Foamy must have exploded!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looking at Martin in stupidity_] He was a detective, you know! _Niles's cell phone rings.  Niles digs deep amongst the foam and pulls it out._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?  Yes, Maris.  You are?  You do?  You will?  That's wonderful!  I'll be right over!  Goodbye. [_turning to the rest_] The divorce papers were a bluff.  When I signed them it completely threw her.  She's willing to go into counseling!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, I'm so happy for you! _Niles throws his arms around Frasier with a loud squelch, which obviously leaves Frasier's suit covered in the Hot & Foamy. Frasier just cries.  End of Act 2 _

speaker: Credits
text: Mrs. Foster is back and is speaking to Martin at the door.  She pulls yet another suit (matching) for Eddie and himself out of her bag. Martin thanks her and says goodbye.  He turns round and shows them to Eddie who buries his head under the nearest pillow.  Martin decides the best answer is to just throw them into the cardboard box with the rest of the junk.  However just to make sure, Eddie goes into the box, pulls them out and proceeds to rip them to shreds. _   * * *  ## Guest Appearances    **Guest Starring** ALAN WILDER as Leo MICHAEL McFALL as Messenger LUCK HARI as Waitress GERRY GIBSON as Tom   * * *  ## Synopsis {mike lee}    As Frasier finishes his show, a going-away party is being thrown in the hallway for a retiring employee.  Frasier says he doesn't want to go out, because he'll be expected to hug the guy.  Roz scolds him for his aversion to hugging; she says she even read somewhere that physical contact extends lifespans.  "Well, in that case," Frasier quips, "you'll outlive Styrofoam."  She pushes him out into the hall, where he reluctantly hugs the retiree.  Frasier meets Niles at the Cafe, and compliments him on his tie. Niles proudly says that Maris gave it to him as a gift--she had it made from her "fat pants" when she had her obesity scare.  Frasier wonders if wearing a gift from Maris will make Niles melancholy.  Niles confidently says he will be reuniting with Maris soon; he called her to ask if she'd go into couples' therapy with him, and she said "I'll think about it."  Then a courier comes in and hands Niles an envelope: divorce papers. He offers his condolences, but also compliments Niles's tie.  Daphne sneaks a box of stuff towards the door, but runs into Martin returning with Eddie.  He's annoyed because an old lady they keep running into knitted Eddie a ridiculous tartan sweater that he had to put on just to please her.  Daphne says at least she didn't knit anything for Martin--who then produces an identical hat.  Noticing the box, he realizes Daphne is throwing away all his old stuff.  Daphne says it's useless junk.  Frasier and Niles come back.  Also noticing the box, they root through it and find an old journal with their mother's name on it. Frasier flips through it and realizes it's about them as children. Among other observations, their mother records that "Frasier seems intimidated by physical contact," and "Niles is obsessively neat and easily cowed by females."  Frasier wonders if his aversion to hugging is a deep-seated condition.  Niles is stung by his mother's words; Frasier suggests that he has a chance to assert himself by signing the divorce papers.  Niles says there's a problem: he already sent them back (unsigned), along with a groveling note begging Maris to take him back.  Niles says it's not too late--it's Maris's spa day, so all the servants are playing hookey.  They can sneak into the house and steal the papers back.  _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  ****THANK GOD IT WASN'T SOUP NIGHT****  Frasier and Niles enter the drawing room of the mansion; Frasier is surprised Maris hasn't changed the locks.  Niles finds the envelope on the coffee table.  As they are about to leave, two snarling German Shepherds appear outside the door.  Niles greets them fondly, but they snap at him. "She didn't change the locks," Niles realizes, "she changed the dogs!"  They are trapped.  Niles gets a brainstorm: it's Swedish Meatball Night--they can slip a handful of Maris's relaxant pills into the meat and feed them to the dogs from the upstairs balcony.  Niles runs upstairs to the medicine cabinet while Frasier runs to the kitchen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, I just thought of something!  What if Maris is out of pills?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing hysterically_] Thank you, Frasier, I needed that.  After several meatballs plunk into the fountain, Frasier yells up at Niles to stop trying to throw.  "You can drop straight, can't you?!" Niles does, and the dogs eat it up.  As they wait for the pills to take effect, Frasier notices a large painting of Maris on the wall (looking at the camera, so we can't see it).  He asks if it's recent.  Niles says no, he and Maris had it done a few years ago.  Frasier says Niles isn't in the picture--just Maris standing next to a large tree.  Niles is outraged--she's had him painted out!  Frasier gently tells him to check the face of the skunk in the bushes.  Niles bitterly admits that it's only right for him to be depicted as a laughingstock in that house; just look around, the room is a "monument to his spinelessness," full of gifts he gave Maris to "apologize" for things--like a golden candelabra for his attempts to grow a mustache.  Frasier says, "I think you owe us all a candelabra for that one!"  Well, Niles decides, no more.  He takes a pen, signs the divorce papers, and drops them back on the coffee table (after removing his groveling note).  Frasier asks him if he's sure.  Niles says he is. Then the dogs nod off.  Frasier suggests they take the back door out, just to be safe.  Niles says no, one last time he wants to walk out of the house with his head held high.  Frasier bolts out the back door anyway; Niles says, "Right behind you!"  Martin takes his shaving-cream warmer from the box and goes into the powder room to plug it in, to show Daphne how useful his "junk" is. They just have to wait five minutes.  Frasier and Niles come back, telling Martin and Daphne the news; Niles is on the road to divorce.  They offer their support; Martin says that in the long run, Niles will be much happier, "I know I will!"  Frasier suggests they all go out for a celebratory dinner. Martin and Daphne go to their rooms to change.  Frasier tells Niles it's finally over--if he wants, he never has to see Maris again.  Niles says he could barely see her when she was standing right in front of him.  They laugh, but then Niles starts hyperventilating--he's just ended his marriage!  Frasier rushes to reassure him it was the right decision.  To help, he rereads the entry in their mother's journal.  But as he reads on, he realizes that it's really a scientific journal, and "Frasier and Niles" were their mother's two favorite lab rats!  The last entry chronicles her sadness as "Frasier" passes away, comforted by the fact that she's about to give birth to her firstborn child.  Now Niles has a full-blown panic attack.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you realize what this means?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes . . . our mother named us after rodents.  No, Niles shouts, he's made a terrible mistake!  Frasier says his judgment was sound; Niles says his judgment was based on his mother's opinion of household vermin!  Martin and Daphne come back to see Niles stumbling into the powder room in a daze, saying he needs some water on his face.  As he closes the door, Frasier shouts that his life is not over . . . then everyone jumps at what sounds like a GUNSHOT!  Frasier slowly opens the door and sees . . . Horror!  Niles is covered head-to-toe in foamy shaving lather.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you know what happened?  My shaving cream can must have exploded!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastic_] He was a detective, you know!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, how do you feel?
